intro: Rhodiola odorata, commonly known as the golden root or roseroot, is a perennial plant native to cold climates of the Arctic, alpine regions, and mountainous areas of Europe, Asia, and North America. The plant is known for its adaptogenic properties and is often cultivated for its medicinal uses. Rhodiola odorata thrives in poor, well-drained soils and is typically found in rocky or sandy environments. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
